bibl.title: Letter from M.A. Barber to Laura Armistead Carter, June 2, 1929

div1.p: Barber thanks Laura Carter for helping adapt her father's malaria notes for a publication.

div1.head: Letter from M.A. Barber to Laura Armistead Carter, June 2, 1929
div1.p:
Very many thanks
for your kind letter of May 31, and your
assistance in preparing Dr. Carter's letter on
malaria in Virginia. I am most grateful
for this letter and your own help. I
shall use it as it is. - if any slight
change (there may be none)it would be one
to make one or two points plain to a
non-malarious reader. I shall ask Mr. Komp
to send you a reprint after I have gone,

I shall be glad to
give your remembrances to the malaria
and Y. F. gangs and especially to Dr. Hayne.
The I. N. D. people tell me he is a “jewel.”

I hope to arrange to stop in
Washington on my way to N. Y. about
June 24 or 25, and shall call you up.

Maybe Africa will treat me
worse than your work has treated you-
I mean in regard to Y. F. or malaria, but
it is all part of the game, I certainly
hope you will fully recover.
With very many thanks I am.
